summary:
We need to produce JSON with summary, business_intent, keywords list.

We have class CpmAntTokenizer: constructs a CPMAnt tokenizer based on byte-level BPE. Handles special tokens: beginning/end of document, sequence, padding, unknown, line, space. Provides methods for token-id conversion, decoding, tokenizing, building inputs with special tokens, checking, converting tokens to string, getting special token masks, vocab, newline id, saving vocab, vocab size.

We need to summarize class responsibility and state/behavior. Business intent: likely to provide tokenization for Chinese language models (CPM Ant) for NLP tasks, enabling preprocessing of text into token IDs for model input, handling special tokens for document boundaries, etc.

Keywords: tokenizer, byte-level BPE, special tokens, vocab, token-id mapping, encoding, decoding, NLP preprocessing, CPMAnt, language model.

Now produce JSON.

Make sure no method names verbatim. So avoid listing method names directly. Use description.

Let's craft summary: "Implements a byte‑level BPE tokenizer tailored for the CPMAnt language model, loading a vocabulary file and managing a set of special tokens (document, sequence, padding, unknown, line, space). Provides conversion between tokens and IDs, tokenization of raw text, decoding of token sequences, construction of model‑ready input sequences with appropriate special tokens, and utilities for vocab inspection and persistence."

Business intent: "Enable preprocessing of textual data for CPMAnt models, facilitating consistent token‑ID representation and handling of special markers required by downstream NLP tasks such as language modeling, text generation, and classification."

Keywords list.

Now produce JSON.

Make sure to start with {{ and end with }} as per example. Actually they said "Output ONLY valid JSON starting with {{ and ending with }}." That's unusual—they want double braces? Example: {{"summary": "...", ...}}. So we need to output double curly braces at start and end. Provide JSON inside.

Let's craft.

Keywords: ["tokenizer", "byte-level BPE", "special tokens", "vocabulary", "token‑id mapping", "text preprocessing", "CPMAnt", "NLP", "encoding", "decoding"].

Now produce final answer.assistantfinal{{"summary": "Implements a byte‑level BPE tokenizer for the CPMAnt language model, loading a vocabulary file and managing a suite of special tokens (document boundaries, sequence delimiters, padding, unknown, line and space markers).
